sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a circle.
message_1: A circular basketball court has a radius of 28 feet. What is the perimeter of the court?
message_2:
The perimeter of a circle is also known as its circumference. The formula to calculate the circumference of a circle is C = 2πr, where C is the circumference and r is the radius.

Given that the radius of the basketball court is 28 feet, we can plug this value into the formula:

C = 2π(28)

C ≈ 2 × 3.14159 × 28

C ≈ 175.929

The perimeter (circumference) of the circular basketball court is approximately 175.93 feet.
